Bay of Plenty builders lose work to out-of-towners amid construction downturn https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/bay-of-plenty-builders-lose-work-to-out-of-towners-amid-construction-downturn/RKGRJ3VLIBDVBMR6SRO4VH6IZE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/bay-of-plenty-builders-lose-work-to-out-of-towners-amid-construction-downturn/RKGRJ3VLIBDVBMR6SRO4VH6IZE/ Kiri Gillespie'A high volume of tradies [are] jumping in the ute and trying to grab some of the work' Wed, 08 May 2024 17:03:00 +0000 Builders are travelling out of town to pick up work from neighbouring towns and cities amid a nationwide slowdown.
East Coast Angus Bull Week showcases top studs, sales set for June https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/09/east-coast-angus-bull-week-showcases-top-studs-sales-set-for-june/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/09/east-coast-angus-bull-week-showcases-top-studs-sales-set-for-june/ Murray RobertsonThe Bull Walk cattle 'looked pretty smart' considering they had a wet winter last year. Wed, 08 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Turihaua Angus was among the cattle studs in the region that presented their 2024 line-ups of rising 2-year-olds this week and they looked impressive across the various studs, which augurs well for a strong sales season in late June. Photo / Liam Clayton
Clive Bibby: Woke agenda had the Grim Reaper watching https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/09/woke-agenda-had-the-grim-reaper-watching/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/09/woke-agenda-had-the-grim-reaper-watching/ Clive BibbyOPINION: Editorial content key to Gisborne newspaper's survival, says column writer. Wed, 08 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 We should be thanking the new owners of our local newspaper for saving it from the "Grim Reaper", who was watching from the sidelines its slow demise as a result of self-inflicted wounds, writes Clive Bibby. Illustration / DAJ
Tairāwhiti seabed surveys show dramatic improvement https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/09/tairawiti-seabed-surveys-show-dramatic-improvement/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/09/tairawiti-seabed-surveys-show-dramatic-improvement/ Seafloor ecosystem recovery off Gisborne, Hawke's Bay, since cyclone. Wed, 08 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Surveys led by Niwa marine biologist Daniel Leduc (pictured) have shown considerable improvement in the seabed quality off the Tairāwhiti and Hawke's Bay coasts that were badly impacted by sediment in the wake of Cyclone Gabrielle.
